alert.note: Alert for Kent; Queen Anne's (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 5:00PM EDT until July 29 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern New Castle County in northern Delaware... Northern Kent County in central Delaware... Northeastern Queen Anne`s County in northeastern Maryland... Kent County in northeastern Maryland... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 500 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Havre De Grace to near Betterton to North Point State Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Dover, Middletown, Smyrna, Chestertown, Clayton, Delaware City, Cheswold, Millington, Sudlersville, Hartly, Woodland Beach, Glasgow, Newtown, Port Penn, Morgnec, Delaney Corner, Crumpton, Dover Speedway, Saint Georges and Sassafras. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
